title: Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs Recipe
description: Tasty chicken kabobs marinated in a rosemary and ranch sauce are tender and juicy, and bursting with so much flavor — they'll melt in your mouth.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs 4.7 (4,808) 3,431 Reviews 374 Photos These rosemary-ranch chicken kabobs are so delicious, tender, and juicy, they practically melt in your mouth. Even the pickiest eater will be begging for the last piece. Submitted by Theresa Spencer Updated on November 14, 2022 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 374 374 374 374 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 35 mins Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins Servings: 5 Yield: 10 skewers Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings ½ cup olive oil ½ cup ranch dressing 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce 1 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary 1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste (Optional) 2 teaspoons salt 1 teaspoon lemon juice 1 teaspoon white vinegar ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste 5 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes 10 (6 inch) wooden skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes Directions Whisk olive oil, ranch dressing, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary, sugar, salt, lemon juice, vinegar, and pepper together in a medium bowl; let stand for 5 minutes. Add chicken to the bowl and stir until coated; cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Remove chicken from marinade and shake off excess. Thread marinated chicken onto skewers; discard remaining marinade. Cook chicken skewers on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 4 to 6 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). I Made It Print 6,707 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 318 Calories 34g Fat 3g Carbs 0g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 318 % Daily Value * Total Fat 34g 44% Saturated Fat 5g 25% Cholesterol 7mg 2% Sodium 1109mg 48% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Protein 0g 1% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 20mg 2% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 98mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs 01 of 374 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 374 Photo by  Shannon Dick 10/15/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Worth the effort I followed the recipe except substituted dried rosemary. Marinated for 30 minutes. Marinade looked gross, but smelled delicious and the chicken was perfect. Served with buttered rice and even my picky eater ate a skewer! 03 of 374 Photo by  DREGINEK 07/04/2024 Halved the recipe since only serving for two. This recipe is so easy yet, so amazing!! While I made zero changes to the marinade, I added 1” pieces of red onion and red bell pepper plus small button mushrooms to my skewers to make a full meal on a stick. Excellent!! Excited to make this again! Thanks Theresa!! 04 of 374 Photo by  carrie 01/09/2024 Worth the effort I made it according to the recipe, it was so delicious! 05 of 374 Photo by  Samantha Allingham 09/03/2022 This is easily my favorite chicken recipe. I like to skip the skewers and just bake the chicken breast pieces on tinfoil for 10-13 minutes, then broil on high for 2 minutes. Super succulent every time. 06 of 374 Photo by  HotKale3375 09/02/2022 So good! 07 of 374 Photo by  Kim Oppliger 08/22/2021 08 of 374 Photo by  Taris 07/17/2021 Soooo, I decided to cook these as tenders in a cast iron skillet & threw in chopped onions & sliced green bell peppers & OMGGG!!!! They were absolutely deeelicious!!! So tender, so juicy & so flavorful!! The only other thing I did different was 1 tsp salt & 1 tsp Lowery’s seasoned salt. I will totally make this again & I will try them as kebabs one day too! So pleased with this recipe! You won’t be disappointed! 09 of 374 Photo by  rmjohnst 06/23/2021 Thanks for sharing! Very tasty recipe and will use again and again! 10 of 374 Photo by  Ema 05/19/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Marinated Greek Chicken Kabobs 314 Ratings Greek Chicken 495 Ratings Grilled Chicken Spiedies 68 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Bacon Ranch Chicken Skewers 247 Ratings Honey Mustard Grilled Chicken 2,589 Ratings Chili-Lime Chicken Kabobs 1,008 Ratings Key West Chicken 1,574 Ratings Grilled Greek Yogurt Marinated Chicken 214 Ratings Special Chicken Kabobs 4 Ratings Marinated Chicken Kabobs 114 Ratings Chicken Kebabs 2 Ratings Green Chili Chicken Burgers 92 Ratings Grilled Hawaiian Chicken and Pineapple Sandwiches 91 Ratings Ray's Chicken 273 Ratings Vietnamese Lemongrass Chicken 82 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Theresa Spencer
instructions: Whisk olive oil, ranch dressing, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary, sugar, salt, lemon juice, vinegar, and pepper together in a medium bowl; let stand for 5 minutes. Add chicken to the bowl and stir until coated; cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.;Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.;Remove chicken from marinade and shake off excess. Thread marinated chicken onto skewers; discard remaining marinade.;Cook chicken skewers on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 4 to 6 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
